title: Pound lower v $US after call for UK election
text:
New York | The British pound fell against the US dollar following Prime Minister Boris Johnson's call for a national election.

Johnson said he was asking parliament to approve a national election on December 12 in an effort to break the political deadlock over Brexit and ensure the UK leaves the European Union.

The pound has risen nearly 5 per cent in October as the chances of a no-deal exit have been all but eliminated. Bloomberg

The added uncertainty brought on by an election may hurt the pound in the near term. It was last down 0.47 per cent at $US1.285 and 1.43 per cent lower this week.

Having surged to a 5-1/2 month high on Monday, sterling fell on Tuesday after British lawmakers blocked Johnson's plan to push through a withdrawal agreement and get the UK out of the EU on October 31.

"Is the election positive for GBP? I argue no. The campaign will see polling swings, and investor inflows may slow whilst they wait for the result. It's why we are long EUR/GBP," Nomura analysts told clients.
description: The UK currency slid 0.5pc, extending its loss so far this week to more than 1.4pc against its US counterpart.
